lexUnit.name: glisten.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shine or sparkle (as on something wet or moist)

sentence.text: Already , tears were beginning to glisten in her eyes .
She felt frustrated and alone , and a tear glistened in her eye as she lay there on her back with Fred 's limp arm lying heavily across her breasts .
She laughed , even though tears were glistening in her eyes .
Flack 's skin glistened in the white , gritty light , his thin face tight with fatigue .
The chalice glistens in the light .
Beneath her , hills grew into majestic mountains and a lake glistened in early morning light .
He stood straighter in the water , his broad chest glistening wetly in the multicoloured light .
The white stripe on his face glistened in the early light .
It was a sunny day and Gorman 's head was glistening in the sun .
The tide was out and , to my right , vast acres of mud glistened in the light of the low sun , a rich feeding ground for waders .
Another was of the château , the water of the lake glistening in the evening sun .
Its paint glistened black .
Every surface glistened green and a sickly white .
It glistened in his fingers as he bent to study it .
Everywhere you look , little shards of glass glistening in the lamplight .
The black threads glistened in the torchlight , blood seeping from the wound where she had opened it again .
Presently a window was opened and framed a sharp white peak which seemed to be hanging almost directly overhead ; it glistened like a great diamond .
Opposite were the elegant backs of Victorian houses , their grey bricks swelling into bow-windows , the roof-tiles glistening like wet flint .
The tar on the roads glistened like liquid quicksilver .
Tears still glistened on one of her cheeks .
His face was grim ; beads of sweat glistened on his forehead .
In the gardens the grass glistened with dew , which left imprints where the soldiers ' feet had passed .

Her dress , cunningly draped around her plump figure , made her look almost voluptuous ; and over her shoulders was carelessly thrown her Persian lamb coat , which made Mrs Frizzell 's eyes glisten with envy .
She scurried around the corner into Barley Hill , but by the time she reached number 52 her hair was glistening with raindrops .
His cheeks glistened with tears and his hand hovered over the head of the thing he had called his son .
He looked at the hand -- pale and elegant , with prominent knuckles , the nails glistening with red varnish .
A film of moisture glistened across his forehead as he sweated under the lights and he dabbed at it with a handkerchief .
The caviare glistened between Himmler 's teeth .
The pavements glistened beneath the yellow lamplight .
We all moved out of the church down to the lake which glistened brightly , though the island itself was still mist-shrouded .
Her eyes glistened softly .
The tramp looked up and glared maliciously back ; he was sucking on a chicken bone and the stubble of his beard glistened .
